msContents.summary: I) Dǝrsān maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” (fols. 2r-71vb l.4) I-1) Introductory prayer (fols. 2r-2va l.2) I-2) Reading for Monday, Compline (nǝwam) (fols. 2va l.4-14rb l.5); containing homily (fols. 2va l.4-6va l.12; 6vb l.9-9rb l.11; 9va l.8-12rb l.4), absolution prayer (fols. 6va l.13-6vb l.9; 9rb l.12-9va l.8; 12rb l.5-12va l.2) and ʾarke (fols. 12va l.3-14rb l.5) I-3) Reading for Tuesday, Matins (manfaqa lelit) (fols. 14ra l.8 -23vb l.10); containing homily (fols. 14ra l.8-19vb l.1; 19vb l.19-21va l.9; 21vb l.8-22va l.5), absolution prayer (fols. 19vb l.2-19vb l.18; 21va l.10-21vb l.7) and ʾarke (fols. 22va l.6-23vb l.10) I-4) Reading for Wednesday, Lauds (nagh) (fols. 23vb l.11-32vb l.15); containing homily (fols. 23vb l.11-29ra l.4; 29rb l.5-30ra l.9; 30rb l.10-31rb l.5), absolution prayer (fols. 29ra l.5-29rb l.4; 30ra l.10-30rb l.9; 31rb l.6-31va l.4) and ʾarke (fols. 31va l.5-32vb l.15) I-5) Reading for Thursday, Terce (śalastu säʿat) (fols. 32vb l.16-43vb); containing homily (fols. 32vb l.16-38va l.7; 38vb l.8-40rb l.6; 40va l.5-42rb), absolution prayer (fols. 38va l.8-38vb l.7; 40rb l.7-40va l.4; 42va-42va l.17) and ʾarke (fols. 42va l.18-43vb) I-6) Reading for Friday, Sext (qätr) (fols. 44ra-54rb l.1); containing homily (fols. 44ra-45va l.14; 46vb l.7-48ra l.13; 48va l.10-51rb l.17; 51va l.15-52ra l.14), absolution prayer (fols. 48ra l.14-48va l.9; 51rb l.18-51va l.14; 52rb l.15-52va l.12), 2 miracles (fols. 45va l.14-46vb l.6; 52ra l.15-52rb l.14) and ʾarke (fols. 52va l.13-54rb l.1) I-7) Reading for Saturday, None (täsaʿtu säʿat) (fols. 54rb l.2-64vb l.13); containing homily (fols. 54rb l.2-57ra l.14; 57rb l.14-60va l.8; 62ra l.4-63ra l.5), miracle (fols. 60va l.9-61vb l.7), absolution prayer (fols. 57ra l.15-57rb l.13; 61vb l.8-62ra l.3; 63ra l.6-63rb l.3) and ʾarke (fols. 63rb l.4-64vb l.13) I-8) Reading for Sunday, Vespers (śark) (fols. 64vb l.15); containing homily (fols. 64vb l.15-67va l.13; 67vb l.12-69ra l.18; 79rb l.16-70ra), absolution prayer (fols. 67va l.14-67vb l.11; 69ra l.19-79rb l.15; 70rb-70rbl.16) and ʾarke (fols. 70rbl.17-71vb l.4) II) Säʿatat za-mäʿalt “Horologium for the Day Hours” (fols. 71va l.6-79rb): za-nagh (fols. 71va l.6-72va l.4); za-śalast (fols. 72va l.4-73rb l.3); za-qätr (fols. 73rb l.4-74rb l.14); za-täsäʿatu säʿat (fols. 74rb l.15-75rb l.6); za-śark (fols. 75rb l.7-76rb l.3); za-nǝwam (fols. 76rb l.4-77rb l.14); za-manfaqa lelit (fols. 77rb l.15-79rb l.9); concluding prayer (fol. 79rb l.10-19).

handNote.seg: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; 1st, 2nd, 6th, 7th, 13th and 14th line on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines of parts of Text II; a few lines of the beginning of the daily readings and their sections in Text I; the words salām laki, sǝḥat läkä and their abbreviations in Text II; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. The names Walatta Mikāʾel (fol. 31va, 32vb, 71vb) and Walda ʾAbiyä ʾƎgzʾi (fol. 38vb) are written in strong crimson.
